Package gw.plugin.security

Provides basic support for the security plugin architecture AuthenticationSource An authentication source is the representation of user credential information.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AuthenticationMethod
    Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
    AuthenticationServicePlugin
    The authentication service plugin is used to authorize a user from AuthenticationSource data.
    AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler
    Callback handler used by the AuthenticationServicePlugin to communicate with the server.
    AuthenticationSource
    A marker interface representing an authentication source.
    AuthenticationSourceCreatorPlugin
    This plugin is responsible for creating an AuthenticationSource from an HTTPRequest object.
    WebservicesAuthenticationPlugin
    This plugin is responsible for authenticating WSI webservice requests.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AuthenticationSource.Failure
    Possible types of login failure.
    AuthenticationSourceCallback
    JAAS style authentication callback handler.
    CredentialVerificationResult
    Result of verifying an internal credential using AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler
    DefaultWebservicesAuthenticationPlugin  
    UsernamePasswordAuthenticationMethod
    Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
    UserNamePasswordAuthenticationSource
    A simple authentication source that holds the username and password.
    UserValueNVP
    User: dbrewster Date: Jun 1, 2005 Time: 4:19:18 PM
    WebservicesAuthenticationContext  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AuthenticationException
    Thrown if the user trying to login cannot be authenticated.
    InactiveUserException
    Exception that gets thrown when a user with a credential marked as inactive attempts to log in.
    InvalidAuthenticationSourceData
    Thrown when an invalid authentication source type is passed to an authentication service.
    LockedCredentialException
    Thrown by an authentication plugin when the users credential has been locked for some reason.
    MustWaitToRetryException
    Exception thrown by an authentication plugin when an attempt has been made to authenticate a user that has been temporarily locked out of the system.

Package gw.plugin.security Description

Provides basic support for the security plugin architecture

AuthenticationSource

An authentication source is the representation of user credential information. This class is used as an abstraction of what can be very disparate credential information in single sign on systems. For instance, a simple version of this class is UsernamePasswordAuthenticationSource. This class is a simple representation of credential information in the form of username/password combinations.

AuthenticationSourceCreatorPlugin

The authentication source creator plugin is used to convert HTTP Servlet input parameters into an authentication source. The type of authentication source this plugin creates is completely up to the implementation of the authentication source creator plugin. It is important to note that all authentication services must handle UsernamePasswordAuthenticationSource.

AuthenticationServicePlugin

This plugin is responsibile for doing the authentication in the system. The input to the primary method is an authentication source. The authentication service plugin's primary job is to take an authentication source and authenticate the user based on the source.
NOTE: All authentication service plugins must handle the UsernamePasswordAuthenticationSource object.
